summary: This bill designates a section of 16th Street Northwest in Washington, D.C., as “Oswaldo Payá Way.” The bill's findings express support for Cuban human rights activist Oswaldo Payá, citing his efforts to promote democracy in Cuba and recognizing his death. The bill mandates the renaming of the specified street segment and the address of the Cuban Embassy, as well as the installation of street signs. The bill's intent is to honor Payá and express solidarity with the people of Cuba.
